Click "Request Runtime Report" button to request runtime details from ecobee. Select up to a 7 day period and one or more Load Groups for requested runtime details. This process may take several minutes to complete. Once all data is received, the report will be available and the download button next to the individual request will be enabled. Click the button next to the requested item to download the file.
The selected date range is too long.
No device serial numbers exist for specified load group(s).
Report out of date - refresh the page

These issues indicate that the Yukon system and the ecobee system are out of sync in some way.
  • Missing Set: A load management group exists in Yukon that does not have a corresponding management set in ecobee.
  • Mislocated Set: The management set in ecobee corresponds to a Yukon load management group, but the set is in an unexpected location in the ecobee hierarchy.
  • Extraneous Set: A management set exists in ecobee that does not correspond to any Yukon load management group.
  • Missing Device: A device exists in Yukon that has no corresponding device in ecobee.
  • Mislocated Device: The device in ecobee corresponds to a Yukon device, but the device is in an unexpected location in the ecobee hierarchy.
  • Extraneous Device: A device exists in ecobee that does not correspond to a device in Yukon.
Yukon will attempt to fix all sync issues.
Ecobee set "{1}" does not correspond to any Yukon group
Device "{2}" is in the wrong ecobee set
Device "{2}" does not correspond to any Yukon device
Ecobee set "{0}" is missing. To fix this issue, Yukon will create the set in ecobee.
Ecobee set "{1}" is mislocated. To fix this issue, Yukon will move the set to "{0}".
Ecobee set "{1}" does not correspond to any Yukon group. To fix this issue, Yukon will delete the set.
Ecobee is missing the device "{2}". To fix this issue, Yukon will add the device to set "{0}".
Device "{2}" is in the wrong ecobee set. To fix this issue, Yukon will move the device from set "{1}" to set "{0}"
Device "{2}" in ecobee set "{1}" does not correspond to any Yukon device. To fix this issue, create and enroll the device in Yukon.
The sync issue could not be fixed due to a communication error with the ecobee server.
The sync issue could not be fixed because the specified set was not found.
The sync issue could not be fixed because the specified device was not found.
Yukon cannot fix this type of sync issue.

Daily performance report is available.
More detail is available on the Broadcast Performance Details page.

The following sync settings are available:
  • Scheduled Sync: When turned On, a time slider will display to select the time to schedule the daily synchronization between Yukon and Nest. Click on the Save button to save any changes.
  • Sync Now: Forces a synchronization between Yukon and Nest.
  • Last Sync Time: Displays the last date/time that Yukon was synced with Nest.

The Discrepancies table will list any differences between Nest and Yukon. The following filter options are available:
  • Sync Time: the date/time that Yukon was synced with Nest.
  • Type: Auto/Manual (whether the action required is automatically completed or needs to be done manually).
The resulting table will list the Type of discrepancy (Auto/Manual), Reason for the discrepancy, and Action that was completed (Auto) or that needs to be completed (Manual). There is an option to download the results in the cog menu.
Examples of discrepancies that will be displayed:
  • A group is found in Yukon but not in Nest.
  • A group is found in Nest but not in Yukon.
  • A program or area is not found for a Nest group.
  • A group already exists in Yukon with the group name, but is not a nest group.
  • A thermostat was not found in Yukon.
No discrepancies were found between Yukon and Nest with the selected filters.

Below are the statuses:
  • Confirmed Success (Green) - Device received the unique RF Broadcast Performance test message.
  • Confirmed Missed (Orange) - Device did not receive the unique RF Broadcast Performance test message.
  • Unreported (Grey) - Device has not yet reported all data required to confirm or deny receipt of unique RF Broadcast Performance test message.
Disconnect is not available for opted out devices.
